<summary>**Innovative Process for Rapid Assembly of DNA Sequences for Stable Integration into Plant Chromosomes**</summary>

* The invention describes a process for rapidly assembling DNA sequences for stable integration into plant chromosomes. This approach allows for efficient optimization of sequences to be expressed by testing various transcription, translation assembled units, and different protein fusions or targeting or post-translational modifications.

* The process involves assembly of a DNA sequence of interest from two or more precursor vectors by site-specific DNA recombination. The choice of suitable recombinases/integrases is crucial for high efficiency in planta assembly.

* The invention uses the Cre-Lox system from bacteriophage P1, the Flp-Frt system from Saccharomyces cerevisiae, the R-RS system from Zygosaccharomyces rouxii, the integrase from the Streptomyces phage PhiC31, and resolvases. These recombinases/recombination site systems are preferred for this invention.

* The assembly of a DNA sequence of interest from precursor vectors can be facilitated by the presence of helper sequences A′ and B′, which may end up in recombination products that do not contain the DNA sequence of interest. These auxiliary sequences can provide genes of interest for assembly.

* The invention uses a mixture of more than two different precursor vectors for assembling various DNA sequences of interest. The DNA sequences of interest may be the result of random site-specific recombination events between two sets of precursor vectors.

* The assembly of a DNA sequence of interest for stable integration into a chromosome of a plant cell allows for selection of plant cells with the DNA sequence of interest integrated into the chromosomal DNA. The assembly of a functional selectable marker gene is an advantage in some cases, e.g., when the gene of interest is toxic for bacterial cells.

* The assembly of complex vectors in planta from precursor vectors that are of simpler structure can be a further advantage, allowing to avoid complex cloning steps and/or manipulation with unstable DNA structures in bacterial cells. The assembly of DNA sequences of interest for generating different derivative vectors in allelic position toward each other is shown in 12.

* The invention is preferably carried out with higher, multi-cellular plants. Preferred plants for use in this invention include agronomically and horticulturally important species. Common crop plants for use in this invention include alfalfa, barley, beans, canola, cowpeas, cotton, corn, clover, lotus, lentils, lupine, millet,

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The present invention is directed to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas. The compressor comprises a cylinder block with cylinder bores disposed parallel to the axis of the cylinder block. A rotary shaft rotatably mounted within the cylinder block carries an aluminum swash plate. The swash plate is fixed to the rotary shaft and has two facial surfaces and an end surface. The facial surfaces have between 0.0005 inches (12.7 μm) to 0.002 inches (50.8 μm) of a heat curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, a lubricious additive and a load bearing additive. The coating on the swash plate permits the use of low silicon alloy aluminum without the need of metal plating or high finish polishing. The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enable the polyfluoro elastomer-based coating to simultaneously provide the necessary durability and low coefficient of friction surface. The fluorocarbon coating is applied to the swash plate in a aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. The swash plate facial surfaces, together with the end surface, may be simultaneously coated. Additionally, the piston shoe may be coated with the fluorocarbon coating to further increase the low friction properties of the compressor. The coating is different from prior swash plate designs having fluororesin coatings by bonding and then cross-linking the fluorocarbon directly to the aluminum. The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enable the polyfluoro elastomer-based coating to simultaneously provide the necessary durability and low coefficient of friction surface. The fluorocarbon coating is applied to the swash plate in a aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. The swash plate facial surfaces, together with the end surface, may be simultaneously coated. The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enable the polyfluoro elastomer-based coating to simultaneously provide the necessary durability and low coefficient of friction surface. The fluorocarbon coating is applied to the swash plate in a aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.

The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole, which is useful in the synthesis of photographic products. <summary>Method and Apparatus for Forming Fiber Mixtures from a plurality of Fiber Types</summary>

* The invention provides a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types by sequentially taking, from different fiber lots, a partial quantity which is small with respect to the entire quantity of the mixture.
* The method includes measuring the entire momentary quantity of the stored fiber lot and determining a certain partial quantity which corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity and continuously removing only from the measured fiber lot the determined partial quantity during each pass.
* The method eliminates the fluctuating dimensions, compressions and weights of the individual fiber bales, allowing the mixture to be obtained without fiber residuals and ensuring an optimally homogeneous mixture.
* The method is adapted for obtaining a mixture of predetermined proportions of fiber types wherein the individual proportions are in each instance taken from a plurality of fiber bales.
* The method is particularly adapted for making mixtures of throughout constant quantity proportions.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

• The present invention is a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, wherein the yarns in at least two layers of fabric are laid at an angle of from 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric. The yarns in the various layers are neither knitted nor woven, but are held together by stitching through the layers, knitting with a loose stitch through the layers, or adhesively bonding threads of the layers at crossing points. The invention provides for the formation of bias laid, non-woven fabrics where all of the yarns in a given layer are parallel to each other, without complex machinery. The number of yarns need not equal the number of needles over a given linear dimension, greater density and uniformity are provided, and the use of the bonding mechanism can aid in the laying of yarns so as to achieve these advantages. The invention is not limited to the use of a sewing machine to bind together the various layers of a bias laid, non-woven fabric, but can be employed in other methods of bonding the layers to each other. The invention is not required to have a separate mechanism for moving the yarn carriers, but can be provided as part of the bonding mechanism. <summary>Field of the Invention: Multiple-color Air Jet Looms and Weft Insertion Methods</summary>
<summary>Objectives: To provide a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in and through warp sheds in a multiple-color air jet loom, in which air under pressure is ejected from a main nozzle unit or subnozzles to produce different weft carrying forces suited respectively for the different weft threads for thereby carrying the weft threads, one at a time, through the warp shed at the same speed under stable conditions and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.</summary>

<summary>**Summary of the Present Invention****

The present invention provides a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, in particular, relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, together with a process of making thereof. The process includes the steps of: health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, then drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips; health preserving said bast fibre strips, spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn. The process also includes health preserving bast fibres, blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres, then opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibres, after that drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips. The process also includes health preserving said multi-fibre strips, spinning the health preserved multi-fibre strips into multi-fibre yarn. The present invention has advantages in terms of reducing end breakage rate and improving spinnability of bast fibres. </summary>

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The present invention provides methods and apparatus for accurately detecting, measuring, and removing rotational variability from a covered roll (e.g., sensing roll) used in nip presses. The invention compensates for this effect, allowing a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile to be calculated and displayed. The apparatus includes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll, which are strategically placed to measure pressure at each CD position. The data collected from these sensors is averaged to provide a more accurate nip pressure profile. The invention can compensate for rotational variability by calculating an average pressure measurement at each cross-directional position, which is then used to create a more accurate nip pressure profile. The results can be displayed on a monitor or other visual screen, and can be used to adjust the nip pressure profile based on the rotational variability. The invention can also be used to compensate for high or low pressure spots along the nip pressure profile.

<summary>Buttonhole Controlling Device for Sewing Machine</summary>

* The invention includes a foot pad that attaches to a presser bar and a travelling assembly with an initial position relative to the foot pad. The travelling assembly moves with work fed during the sewing of a buttonhole and includes a slidable member that may be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn. The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly and cause the length of a buttonhole formed with the buttonhole device be limited to that suitable for the button inserted in the travelling assembly. An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole. By properly positioning the stop, an operator can precisely define the closure point and so prevent the formation of an open buttonhole or one in which stitches overlap. The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly, and a tripping lever. The device is adapted to control the operation of the tripping lever and flexible contacts to cause the machine to sew a buttonhole when in a buttonhole mode. The device is particularly adapted to accomplish the primary objective of the invention but is generally similar to the device disclosed in U.S. Pat. <summary>Summary of the Application</summary>

* The application is a continuation of Ser. No. 919,223, filed on October 15, 1986, now abandoned.
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
* German Patent No. 830 040 discloses a technique of spraying a treatment solution onto a moving textile web at several points along the direction of transport, with the solution applied at a certain point being removed by suction before additional solution is applied.
* German Patent No. 830 040 is applicable to knitted fabrics, but not to printed materials.
* As disclosed in German Patent Document No. 23 62 109, an endless sieve belt passes over a pair of guide drums, with cloth spread out on an upper section or segment of the belt, and the cloth is guided on the belt while lying flat and completely slack.
* The distance between the point of application of the liquid and the suction point is relatively short, with the consequence that the liquid has little time to act on the substances to be removed from the web.
* German Petty Patent No. 17 40 815 discloses a boot-like water-filled washing chamber in which the fabric is placed in a stacked configuration, with chamber the fabric being guided on the belt while lying flat and completely slack.
* The distance between the point of application of the liquid and the suction point is relatively short, with the consequence that the liquid has little time to act on the substances to be removed from the web.
* German Petty Patent No. 17 40 815 is applicable to knitted fabrics, but not to printed materials.
* An object of the present invention is to provide an improved apparatus of the above-described type.
* Another, more particular, object of the present invention is to provide such an apparatus in which a washing or rinsing may be adequately effectuated without maintaining the textile web in a stacked configuration.
* The invention is particularly advantageous in that effective washing is possible without soiling a white background, inasmuch as the washing solution is spread onto the textile web and the cloth is neither placed into a stacked configuration nor run through a vat or the like.
* A preferred area of application of the invention is so-called "soilage washing," because considerable amounts of soilage can be removed at relatively little expense.

<summary>Method for Manufacturing Two-Sided Nonwoven Fabrics with Enhanced Three-Dimensional Image Properties</summary>
* The present invention involves a method of forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric, which exhibits a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to both converting and end-use application. The method includes providing a first precursor web comprising a fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second matrix. The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface having a three-dimensional image transfer device. The precursor webs are formed into a three-dimensional image transfer device. The precursor webs are advanced onto the imaging surface of the image transfer device. Hydroentanglement of the precursor web is affected to form a three-dimensional imaged fabric. The incorporation of a fiber distribution control layer acts to limit the ability of the fibrous constituent of the first precursor web and the second precursor web from becoming excessively intermixed, and yet results in a nonwoven fabric that exhibits sufficient resistance to delamination. <summary>Summary of the Field and Background of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a sewing machine with a guide chute for a strip of material overlaid on a bed plate, which is fed by a feed dog into association with a needle. The device includes a control setup with a stop arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding thereof, which is displaceable out of the feed path and connected by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material. The device also includes a mounting plate pivoted to the bed plate for guiding the edge of the cut of fabric, an arcuate web and guide edge for guiding a strip of material, and a control setup with a stop arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding thereof, which is displaceable out of the feed path and connected by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material. The device also includes a mounting plate pivoted to the bed plate for guiding the edge of the cut of fabric, an arcuate web and guide edge for guiding a strip of material, and a control setup with a stop arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding thereof, which is displaceable out of the feed path and connected by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material.</summary>

<summary>Summary of the Connective Knitting Method</summary>

* The present invention provides a connective knitting method for knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces, which can be used in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric.
* The method comprises knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are composed to be movable in the lateral direction.
* In the knitting process, symmetrical loops of the final course of both the knit pieces are overlapped across the boundary and bound off gradually.
* The method repeats the step of forming a new loop on an overlaid loop by a proper number of times depending on the width of the knit fabric until the end parts of both knit fabrics are connected.
* The end parts of both knit fabrics are joined by knitting yarn supplied from the carrier, and the final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch.
* The invention can be applied to various parts of the body, such as the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, a neck rope portion of an apron, and other parts linking the tape- or rope-shaped portions.
* The flat knitting machine used in the invention is composed of multiple knitting needles on needle beds facing each other, and the invention may be realized if two pairs or more of needle beds are provided.
* The invention can be used in the same way as the flat knitting machine, and the method can be controlled by a computer to follow a designed knitting pattern.

<summary>**Summary of the Invention**</summary>
* The invention relates to a traction element made of flexible thermoplastic plastics material, including a core strand sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
* The traction element can be wound and unwound, and is suitable for lifting and pulling loads.
* The traction element includes at least six peripheral strand cords wound around a central strand cord designated a core strand.
* The strands themselves are made of individual fibres or wires of a material guaranteeing tensile strength.
* The flexibility of a conventional stranded cable can be significantly increased by embedding the core strands.
* The core strands are coated with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer prior to applying the peripheral strand cords.
* The thickness of the thermoplastic plastics material layer is expediently in the range of 0.1 to 1 mm.
* The temperature region applied during stranding can cause penetration of the plastics material into cable grooves, but discharge from the surface of the stranded cable is avoided.
* The outer surface of the stranded cables remains bare and is expediently degreased.
* Individual cables are preferably covered with a protective covering, in particular in the case of larger external diameters of the stranded cable in the range of about 5 mm or more.
* The traction element can be wound to form a band-shaped traction element with a plastics material jacket.
* The traction element can be used for lifting and pulling loads, and can be stored on a coiler.
* The traction element can be used for lifting and pulling loads when the traction element is deflected once or repeatedly and/or stored on a coiler.

<summary>Field and Background of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine. The hook arrangement includes a bobbin housing with a laterally projecting holding finger that prevents rotation of the bobbin housing against the hook body. The spring rod extends between the cams on the bobbin housing and cooperates with the cutout in the bobbin capsule to prevent the bobbin housing from rotating counter to the hook body. The capsule release device is used to counteract the rotation of the bobbin housing. The hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture. The rotary hook is particularly effective for lockstitch sewing machines due to its low friction motion and low needle thread tension.

<summary>Electrospinning Methods for Producing Silicon-Based Nanowires and Films</summary>
Electrospinning is a viable method for utilizing liquid cyclosilanes (Si n H 2n ) and linear or branched silanes (Si n H 2n+2 ) in the fabrication of electronic materials. Four-component and five-component inks are particularly useful with electrospinning procedures and the formation of micro and nanofibers are used as an illustration. The inks can also be used with other deposition techniques such as thin film deposition techniques. Single or coaxial nozzle formation of nanofibers is used to illustrate the methods. However, it will be understood that the inks and methods of the invention are appropriate for any electrospinning technique including use with devices that have multiple nozzles, drums or films. </summary>

<summary>**Summary of the Invention****

The present invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel, comprising a plurality of controllers that are simultaneously settable by fluid pressure. Each controller is coupled to a different corresponding one of the spool holders. The controllers have a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element coupled to the brake rotor. The arrangement also has a tensioning lever coupled to the braking element for biasing it. The tensioning lever has a roller adapted to engage and be biased by the threads. This tensioning lever is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight. Additionally, a biasing arrangement adapted to be activated by fluid pressure and connected to the tensioning lever, each of the tension levers being simultaneously settable by the fluid pressure. The force generated by the preferred biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, whereby the thread tension is also altered. When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased, allowing a quick braking action to be possible. The biasing arrangement operates by fluid pressure, which can influence the tensioning lever without hindering the swinging action necessary for the control procedure. The brake shoe can be held by the tensioning lever, giving rise to a simple construction with few additional parts. The tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe on restart of the warping machine is removed from contact with the further braking surface, preventing locking. The brake rotor may be a brake drum, wherein the braking element is a braking band contactable therewith and tensionable by the tensioning lever. The braking element is magnetic and can be displaced by the tensioning lever into a position more or less covering the braking disc. The magnetic system can comprise a permanent magnet adjacent one of a pair of legs straddling the braking disc. The brake rotor is a braking disc of electro-conductive material and the braking element is a magnetic system, which is displaceable by the tensioning lever into a position more or less covering the braking disc. The magnetic system can also be a brake drum, wherein the braking element is a braking band contactable therewith and tensionable by the tensioning lever. The brake band 5 is connected at one end to an immovable pin 6 and at the other end via spring 7 to the fixedly supported tensioning lever 8. <summary>• The present invention provides a low-cost, durable needle position detector for a sewing machine, which is designed to minimize stress on optical fibers and reduce vibration caused by shaft movement. • The detector includes a thin, compact detecting section with a thinner and more compact detecting section, and a thinner and more compact optical fiber supporter. • The detector minimizes stress on optical fibers by providing flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs and a flexible optical fiber supporter. • The detector significantly reduces stress on optical fibers due to the absence of curved reflecting portions on the reflective discs. • The detector provides accurate optical axes and a constant and stable operation, even in the presence of shaft vibration. • The detector significantly reduces stress on optical fibers by providing a flexible optical fiber supporter and flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs. • The detector includes an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry and can be run simultaneously with the optical fibers for detection, simplifying the construction.</summary>

<summary>**Summary of the Invention**  
The present invention provides a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves the following critical operations:  
1. Completion of coagulation, which is achieved by passing time without other reagents or liquors except those entrained by the yarn.  
2. Treatment with water having a non alkaline pH, followed by washing under the specified conditions.  
3. Drying, possibly finishing, and drying again.  
The process is carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, and the washing water is weakly acid exchange resin with a pH between 4.0 and 5.5. The criticality of the combination of operations is demonstrated by comparison data with conventional processes, where washing and finishing treatments are required, but not with the preferred conditions of the invention. The degree of whiteness is improved, but not significantly, by the use of weakly acid exchange resin. The invention is not bound to any interpretation of the phenomenon on which the invention is based, and does not go beyond the experimental finding that a simplified, more rapid and more economical process, whenever the conditions of the invention are observed, is always associated with a high degree of whiteness. </summary>

The present invention provides a bedroom cabinet with a floor area approximately equal to an area of a bed, a height such that a user can erect the upper half of his body on the bed, and a circumference completely shut off from the outside except a doorway. The bedroom cabinet can be carried after assembly and completed, and can be simply installed for workmen's quarters or a stadium in a site of construction. The bedroom cabinet can be arranged in a plane on the floor of the building and one bedroom cabinet can be stacked on the other, allowing many workmen to be received in a limited floor area for rest. The bedroom cabinet can also be provided with a flophouse in which a number of bedroom cabinets as described above are installed for users to take a nap at a low charge.

<summary>
Portable, temporary guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a safety barrier at construction sites.
• Provides a portable and simple guard rail system for temporary safety barriers.
• Features a substantially flat bottomed base plate, upright column, guard rail support brackets, kick board retaining flange, and safety tie-off ring.
• Utilizes a concrete-filled steel base for enhanced stability and support.
• Designed to meet safety guidelines and rigidity requirements.
• Suitable for use in various construction environments.
• Reduces the need for costly labor and materials for re-installing guard rails.
• Provides a high return on investment and cost savings.
• Suitable for guard rail support purposes in roof structures, bridge construction, and drop-off edges.

<summary>Summary of the disclosure</summary>
The disclosure provides a splice for a soil reinforcing element, including a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip. The splice further includes a first perforation defined in the first wave plate and a second perforation defined in the second wave plate, and a connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate, wherein a portion of longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and a portion of longitudinal wires of the grid-strip are interposed between the first and second wave plates and are thereby prevented from removal. The composite soil reinforcing element includes a soil reinforcing element having a first plurality of transverse wires coupled to at least two longitudinal wires, the soil reinforcing element having a wall end and a reinforcing end, a grid-strip having a second plurality of transverse wires coupled to at least two longitudinal wires, the grid-strip having a splicing end, and a splice configured to couple the reinforcing end of the soil reinforcing element to the splicing end of the grid-strip. The splice includes a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of the first plurality of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of the second plurality of transverse wires of the grid-strip. The splice for the composite soil reinforcing element includes a first perforation defined on the first wave plate and a second perforation defined on the second wave plate, and a first connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate and clamp down on the at least two longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and the at least two longitudinal wires of the grid-strip.</summary>

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The present invention provides a novel plow blade design that offers a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection. The plow blade is constructed with multiple components that can be easily assembled and reconfigured. The fluid is ejected at specific points along the blade, maximizing the volume of ejected fluid while minimizing the amount of drag. The plow blade is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities, and can be modified using hand tools without welding. The fluid is injected through stitch welds and gaps between stitch welds, providing a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection. The plow blade is designed to be tailored to specific job requirements, allowing for easy customization and efficient production.

<summary>• The present invention is a cavity wall construction technique that allows panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and greater than 4 meters in width to be created without movement joints. The system uses proprietary plaster, reinforced with pre-papered hot dipped galvanised zinc steel wire MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet and other reinforcement, to achieve a nominal thickness of 21 mm with a standard sponge or plastic float finish. The plaster is applied in three coats; a base coat, a levelling coat, and the top coat. The MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet is fabricated from copper bearing cold drawn hot dipped galvanised zinc vertical face wires and horizontal back wires, electrically welded at all points of intersection. The face and back wires are 1.5 mm diameter with openings not exceeding 51 mm. The reinforcement at all external corners is provided by MCL® uPVC Kwik corners being a 55 mm×55 mm angle with nosing and MCL®uPVC Kwik flanges, being 65 mm×15 mm angles with nosing, providing reinforcement at window and door openings. Movement is accommodated by providing physical breaks in the plaster. The system is waterproofed with a 2 coat paint system in accordance with Paragraph 9.3.7 of E2/AS1. <summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a safe structure that includes a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening, a door assembly, and a lock mechanism. The invention provides a simple, yet effective door and safe construction that can be easily assembled and installed in a wall or floor of a residence. The safe is made of a liner with various grooves and slots for receiving steel bars, and the door assembly includes a combination lock and a latch bolt. The invention also includes a firecap for additional protection. The construction is economical and can be easily assembled at the factory.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function and an elastic member, and a method of mounting an elastic member therein.
* The invention is adapted to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations by blocking up the expansion gap in a bridge girder joint with a joint block, and to provide a method of mounting an elastic member therein.
* The invention is adaptable for various tire configurations, ensuring high slip resistance to tires, and providing easy maintenance.
* The invention is particularly useful in applications of vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails, and road bridges, as well as road bed plate joints in road bridges, footbridges, and the like.
* The invention is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations, ensuring high slip resistance to tires, and providing easy maintenance.

<summary>Example embodiments provide a method for manufacturing composed stave floors, including providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane. The example embodiments preserve physical, aesthetic, and functional properties in the sight substrate of composed stave floors or engineering floors. They provide a sight substrate for composite stave compounds or engineering floors without deforming, bond both sheets without displacement or change of dimensions, and offer a major time of useful life and corrective maintenance. The example embodiments also provide improved composed stave floors with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and inconveniences of application in a period of installation. Site preferred glazes include aluminum oxide or another metal that provide higher hardness without changing its aesthetic appearance.</summary>

<summary>TECHNICAL FIELD</summary>
The invention generally relates to ladders, and more specifically to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing the ladder from defacing the work surface, and preventing the ladder from slipping or sliding.

<summary>BACKGROUND OF THE INVENTION</summary>
A ladder is used to help people reach places they would not ordinarily be able to reach. Ladders are often used to climb onto roofs of buildings and are used when washing window or painting. In normal use, the bottom portion of the ladder rests on the ground or other surface, and the top end of the ladder typically leans against the building or work surface. The ladder is oriented at an angle which makes it easy for a user to climb up and down the ladder, and also aids in keeping the ladder from slipping. However, typical ladders often rest on the side of the house with the only contact with the house being a small portion of the siderails of the ladder. When a person on the ladder reaches outside the rails, the center of gravity shifts causing one or both rails may slide along the work surface, thereby damaging the work surface. Therefore, it is highly desirable to have a ladder that has lateral stability under normal working conditions and resists sliding.

<summary>SUMMARY OF THE INVENTION</summary>
The present invention is directed to overcoming one or more of the problems set forth above. Briefly summarized, according to one aspect of the present invention, a brace for a ladder having first and second siderails connected by a rung comprises an extension arm having a flange on one end portion and an opening in the distal end portion. The flange has first and second openings. A U-bolt has its legs inserted through the first and second openings of the flange. The legs have threaded ends and are spaced to receive said ladder rung therebetween. First and second nuts are threadably mateable with the legs of the U-bolt to secure the flange to the U-bolt. A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm.

<summary>OBJECTS OF THE INVENTION</summary>
The present invention provides a non-slip gripping portion for a ladder that grips the work surface without damaging the work surface.

Another object of the invention is to provide ladder which effectively increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface.

Another object of the invention is to provide an attachment for a ladder to improve the lateral stability of the ladder.

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The present invention relates to position and motion sensors, particularly to sensors that can be multiplexed with other sensors to reduce the number of wires and energy required for monitoring and control of moving objects.

<summary>Background</summary>
Many mechanical systems contain moving parts that require monitoring and control with correction schemes for safe or efficient operation. Position and motion sensors are commonly used in these systems to monitor the position and timing of moving objects.

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple position sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system.

<summary>Overview</summary>
The invention includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires. The waveform generator receives an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it in response to an error correction signal for providing a conditioned sensing signal. The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed, and generates a sensor signal output that is close to a desired minimum value.

<summary>Window Reference Circuit</summary>
A window reference circuit constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. The signal processor generates a relatively small reference signal that is large enough to eliminate small values of drift in a negative going direction yet not generate a significant amount of signal due to the discrete nature of the calibration voltages from a DAC and counter combination employed thereby.

<summary>Window Comparator</summary>
A window comparator compares the ideal sensor output to the existing sensor output and adjusts the output if it is below a preset large reference signal or above a preset small reference signal. The comparator generates a low output from the DAC 106 and drives differential amplifier 102 output 102 S low, causing the output 102 S of differential amplifier 102 to rise. The output 102 S of differential amplifier 102 rises above the low end of the window comparator 118 if the sensor output is below the low end of the window.

<summary>Window Compensation</summary>
The invention includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing the sensor output to a desired minimum

<summary>**Flow Deflection Apparatus for High-temperature Turbines**</summary>

* The invention provides a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly for gas turbines, which operates at high temperatures. The apparatus is characterized by a hollow casting form and separate inserts for the cooling channels and separating walls. The inserts are secured by integral material joints and are designed to be flexible and easily adjusted for different applications. The apparatus avoids the disadvantages of casting and internal cooling channels, and is simple to produce and secure. The cooling system can be adjusted by changing the deflection radius of deflection devices or introducing connecting cross sections between cooling channels. The apparatus is particularly advantageous for rotating guide apparatuses such as rotor blades, as it simplifies assembly and attachment of the inserts and ensures well-sealed connections. The cooling fluid flows in mutually opposite directions in two adjacent cooling channels, with deflection from the outlet to the inlet by means of a deflection device. The apparatus is suitable for blade applications in gas turbines, and can be adapted for rotor blades operating at high speeds. The invention offers significant simplifications in terms of casting, material integration, and assembly compared to existing solutions.

<summary>Summary of the invention:</summary>
• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter within the levels permitted by local environmental regulations.
• It burns wood waste at a lower velocity than conventional burners, reducing particulate matter and slag formation.
• The burner operates with preheated underfire air, drying and gasifying the waste fuel in a conical pile.
• It can be adjusted to operate with low fuel volumes or high volumes, providing quick response times and reduced boiler cleaning.
• The burner uses swirl air and secondary combustion air to maintain particulate separation and improve combustion efficiency.
• It can be used for various industrial purposes, including kilns, dryers, and particle boards, while maintaining high heat transfer and low emissions.

<summary>**Fluid Pump Design and Assembly**</summary>

* **Fluid Pump Design**: The fluid pump described in the text is a pump that can pump liquids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure. It features a pump head with two impellers, which are driven by a drive structure to move fluid through multiple conduits. The pump is designed to be connected to two other pump heads in a series, allowing for fluid flow from one pump head to the next in the series. The pump is modular, allowing for easy separation of pump heads and the addition of more pump heads in the series. * **Assembly**: The pump is mounted on a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, and can be assembled using a variety of mounting structures. The pump assembly is designed to be flexible and modular, allowing for easy addition of additional pump heads. The pump is capable of pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure, making it suitable for applications such as animal husbandry operations. * **Mechanical Components**: The pump includes a first impeller and a second impeller, which are mounted on a drive shaft. The drive shaft is connected to a motor, which is powered by a single power source. The pump is designed to be robust and durable, with features such as a closed cap and a combiner for fluid flow. * **Fluid Flow Path**: The pump's fluid flow path is designed to pass through multiple conduits, including first and second fluid conduits, first and second chamber conduits, and first and second outlet conduits. The conduits are designed to be flexible and allow for fluid flow in both directions. * **Modularity**: The pump is modular, allowing for easy separation of pump heads and the addition of more pump heads in the series. This makes it suitable for applications such as animal husbandry operations, where multiple pump heads are needed to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The invention provides a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted in weight to achieve perfect balance. It is made from hardened steel and is suitable for graphite arrows. The point cap can be permanently attached to the arrow shaft, while the balance pin can be used with a wide range of arrow points. The balance pin is made of light material such as aluminum and can be adjusted to obtain a desired point weight. The point cap and balance pin work together to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft when the arrow points are not attached. The invention also includes means to attach points to arrow shafts without using expensive arrow shafts.

<summary>Summary of the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) Invention</summary>

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator designed for use with small arms training. It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing, a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, and an expendable that can be inserted into a weapon via the magazine breech. The simulator produces sound and flash by electrical ignition of pyrotechnic charges in a confined space, with venting of combustion produced in a manner that utilizes the weapon's ejection port. It provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, and is cost-effective and reliable for training with actual weapons.

The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that enhances engine performance by maximizing the dynamic effect of the air flow. The device comprises a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage. The first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations with respect to each other, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage. The valve is disposed in the first passage and is actuated by an actuator responsive to an engine operating condition. The device reduces noise from the air intake by creating a new compound curve comprising each peak portion of the volumetric efficiency curves with respect to the engine speed. The length of the air inlet pipe upstream of the air cleaner should be minimized to enhance performance and reduce noise.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention addresses the challenges of improving fuel economy and durability in rotary internal combustion engines by optimizing the cooling system and housing structure. Key features include:

1. **In-Line Spark Plugs**: The invention utilizes in-line spark plugs for single rotor housing designs, which are installed on the trochoid surface close to the minor axis of the curve. This arrangement minimizes thermal distortion and enhances cooling efficiency.

2. **Cylindrical Bosses**: The invention employs cylindrical bosses for the spark plugs, which are cast into the engine water jacket passageway. The staggered arrangement of bosses with respect to the centerplane of the coolant flow significantly improves cooling performance.

3. **Circumferential Cooling**: The invention combines circumferential cooling with vertical flow, creating a more efficient and uniform cooling regime. This approach reduces thermal distortion and enhances heat transfer efficiency.

4. **Flow Diverters and Controllers**: The invention introduces flow diverters and controllers to ensure a controlled flow regime between the bosses and the coolant, thereby improving heat transfer and reducing thermal stress.

5. **Structural Features**: The invention includes staggered boss arrangements, predetermined offset distances, and flow diverters to optimize the cooling and housing structure, enhancing the overall performance and durability of the rotary engine.

* The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. It uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance, minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing. * The method involves using total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet control valves as a function of valve stem lift. * The flow change due to closure of one of the N parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves. * The flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves, and for the system with N-1 valves, is determined during the turbine design process. * The flow compensation required for a given TCV reference comes from curves 16 and 18 shown in  FIG. 1 , which show the difference in total mass flow for three turbine control valves versus four turbine control valves for different values of valve stem lift.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The present invention provides a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus, including a valve body with a bore for receiving a first fluid at a first predetermined pressure, a second fluid at a second predetermined pressure, an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids, and a valve means for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage. The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% second fluid, 0% first fluid. The invention also includes a flow restricting device for reducing the flow rate of fluid from inlet passage to outlet passage. The invention is applicable to commercial aircraft cleaning systems and allows for the control of fluid pressure and mixing ratios. The valve system is designed to provide a constant pressure cleaning solution to each user, with adjustable mixing ratios for each fluid source. The invention is particularly useful for large-scale cleaning tasks and can be used in both public and commercial aircraft cleaning applications.

• The invention proposes a method for compressing natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas at least during individual intervals to a substantially higher pressure than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by the heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and obtaining the further cooling to the desired exit temperature by expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure. A compressor station for a gas pipeline for carrying out the method includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, additionally valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and the heat exchanger to one another and to the gas pipeline, and control units for controlling the compressor and the valves. The invention starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure (rated pressure of the gas pipeline) to an increased pressure, wherein the compression can be carried out in a single stage or in multiple stages in compressors which are connected in series. During the warmer period of the year, in which the use of re-cooling units was necessary for ensuring the required exit temperature, the invention provides for a different type of cooling. The invention utilizes the known physical effect according to which a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, either by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work. The invention provides that the compression to the excess pressure is carried out in a total of three stages, wherein a predominant portion of the compression takes place in two successive primary stages which are equipped with machines producing approximately the same pressure ratio. The invention provides that the expansion can be carried out in a simple manner, for example, by means of a valve. • The source document discusses a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, which can be utilized in various applications including the automotive, computer, electronic instrumentation, and any industry where forced air movement is used as a temperature controlling medium.
• The system includes a cooling fan assembly mounted to a panel, which can be a stationary member to which the fan assembly is secured.
• The fan assembly includes a motor that rotates a fan blade by way of a motor output shaft.
• The motor is typically an electric motor, but can be an electric motor or a non-electric motor.
• The motor carrier is integrated with the motor to form an integrated unit.
• The height of the turned-out portions of the mounting legs is less than or equal to the height of the recessed portions.
• The compressed spring member urges the motor carrier away from the panel when the fan assembly is fully installed.
• The compressed spring member is designed to prevent vibrational forces from causing the resilient legs to "back out" of their respective residual openings.
• The compressed spring member also prevents vibrational noise from developing between the motor carrier and the panel.
• The compressed spring member is designed to assist in preventing vibrational forces from causing the resilient legs to "back out" of their respective residual openings.

<summary>Summary:</summary>
* The invention provides a new type of kinematic mount that incorporates novel damping features to reduce vibration and improve stability.
* The mount uses vibration damping materials to dissipate energy and reduce the impact on instruments.
* The mount is designed to be flexible and can be used on precision optical instruments and other high-performance machinery.
* The mount can be modified by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts.
* The damping mechanism can be provided at flexural hinge locations of the mounts.
* The mount can be modified to use six identical strut elements in order to reduce manufacturing complexity and costs.
* The mount can achieve modal vibration tests on coupon sample mounts with modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.
* The mount can be used to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The mount can be used to improve the stability of spacecraft structures.
* The mount can be used to reduce the impact on instruments during launch.
* The mount can be used to minimize the loads transmitted to the mounted instrument.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

The Present Invention provides a method for fabricating coated steel blanks that eliminates the formation of intermetallic areas within welded assemblies, thereby preventing localized corrosion and enhancing mechanical properties. The key features include:

1. A precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, where the precoat is removed by brushing or laser ablation.

2. The removal of the precoat by brushing or laser ablation ensures that the intermetallic alloy layer remains in place, preventing the formation of brittle intermetallic areas within the molten metal.

3. The removal of the precoat by brushing or laser ablation is monitored by micrographic examination, allowing for real-time monitoring of the removal process.

4. The method is compatible with existing welding lines and can be integrated into subsequent pressing or heat treatment phases, providing a versatile fabrication process for structural or safety parts in automotive vehicles.

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage which is produced as such under the influence of forming production steps from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and in each case provided to guide rolling bodies. The invention furthermore also relates to a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage. 

<summary>Background</summary>
The object on which the invention is based is to indicate solutions by means of which it is possible to reduce the production costs which arise during manufacture of rolling body guide cages. 

<summary>Summary</summary>
Proceeding from the disadvantages set out of the known prior art, the object on which the invention is based is achieved by a rolling body guide cage with a ring element which is produced from a sheet metal material and has an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures which are arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, the ring element being composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and are connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling. 

The invention has been shown to be particularly advantageous in particular in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm since the process costs associated with the formation of three weld joints are, at this diameter, already substantially below the material costs of the cutting waste which has hitherto arisen. 

The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, in particular cages of groove and angular ball bearings. The rolling body guide cage can be structured such that it is composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry. The per se structurally identical ring elements are preferably put together in such a manner that the weld points formed between the ring segments of the ring elements of both ring elements are offset with respect to one another in the circumferential direction, i.e. a weld point is overlapped by an unwelded point. 

The ring segments can be produced in such a manner that they initially have a slight oversize and are initially further cut and where necessary calibrated after welding in the context of a contouring step. However, the ring segments can in principle also be cut to their final dimensions in terms of their material width and are subsequently only formed and where necessary punched internally.

<summary>System for Compensating Electromagnetic Interfering Fields</summary>

* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, including two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils. The system compensates for inhomogeneous and homogeneous magnetic fields, and can be used for imaging systems and other applications.
* The system uses a digital processor to process the six in total output signals of the two real sensors and calculate the six-dimensional vector {circumflex over (V)} representing the amplitude of the interfering field at the object to be protected.
* The virtual sensor signals generated by the system are fed to independent control loops operating in parallel, and processed further. These control loops may be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency. The control loops change the virtual signals V to modified signals {circumflex over (V)}.
* The algorithm used by the control system is described as follows: O=L·Ω(M·S), where O is a 6×1 matrix representing the control signals for the six coils, L is a 6×6 matrix for calculating the control signals O from the modified signals {circumflex over (V)}, and Ω is an operator for transforming the control signals O into the control signals for the six coils.
* The system can be used for compensating for inhomogeneous and homogeneous magnetic fields, and can be used for imaging systems and other applications.

<summary>Method for Investigating Biological Samples Using CARS Microscopy</summary>

• The invention aims to provide a method for investigating biological samples using CARS microscopy, focusing on the detection of resonance sites and their corresponding structures.
• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
• The invention enables the detection of chemical structures containing the resonance sites using CARS microscopy, providing enhanced three-dimensional spatial resolution.
• The method is suitable for selective imaging of species-specific molecules, such as tags, and can be used for purity checks in biological samples.
• The invention is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and can be used for image-producing methods in CARS microscopy.
• The method can be used in combination with CARS microscopy to enhance the detection of non-resonant background signals.
• The invention is based on the use of bioorthogonal chemical reactions, including 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition and Staudinger ligation, which are known to those skilled in the art.
• The method can be used in combination with CARS microscopy to improve the reproducibility and quantitative accuracy of CARS methods.
• The invention is suitable for use in food chemistry, where it can be used for purity checks and for the analysis of specific molecules in food samples.
• The method can be used in combination with CARS microscopy to enhance the detection of non-resonant background signals, which can be used for image-producing methods in CARS microscopy.
• The invention is suitable for use in the analysis of biological samples, such as cells and tissues, where it can be used for image-producing methods in CARS microscopy.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
* The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions, based on modifying a standard logic rule by pushing more liberal memory based parameter onto stricter logic based parameter.
* The invention provides a system and method of checking design rules to determine whether or not a logic part (all non-memory devices that have to satisfy TLR) of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules (as specified in a TLR document) and the memory part of a mask pattern data obeys memory rules (in this case, logic rules that are modified appropriately for a memory area to accommodate the more liberal values available for such regions).
* The invention provides a solution to the disadvantages of the first and second conventional methods of checking design rules as explained above.
* The invention simplifies the process (i.e., to avoid having to create an entire set of design rule checks from scratch, or to harmonize several different types of design rules from different memory cell vendors) and ensures its accuracy with respect to any particular set of foundry rules.
* The invention is applicable to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks.
* The invention ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group. Correspondingly, all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules (all logic regions that passed logic rules should have also passed memory rules since memory rules are looser compare to logic rules).
* The invention provides a solution to the problems of the first and second conventional methods of checking design rules as explained above.
* The invention provides a solution to the disadvantages of the first and second conventional methods of checking design rules as explained above.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention relates to waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific illumination requirements. These holograms can be used to illuminate display holograms or spatial light modulators. The invention includes a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, which provides extremely high diffraction efficiencies. Non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation. The hologram can be recorded non-uniformly, so that the reconstructed beam is uniform in intensity. Both corrections can be employed. The invention also includes a method for selectively illuminating demanding objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators. The illumination system can occupy less space than conventional lens illumination systems. The invention has advantages in terms of absence of stray light and uniform illumination. However, it may not achieve high efficiency over large area holograms due to the non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront. The invention also has potential solutions for two-sidedness and polarization analysis. The configuration of the waveguide hologram can be modified to achieve higher spectral selectivity. The invention has been disclosed with reference to generic description and specific embodiments. The examples set forth are not intended to be, and shall not be construed as, limiting in any way. Selection of other light sources, objects for illumination, and the like will occur to those of ordinary skill in the art without the exercise of inventive skill, and remain within the scope of the invention as claimed hereinbelow.</details>

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The present invention relates to a memory implementation of a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue (First In First Out), in a functional memory. The solution in accordance with the invention is intended for use specifically in connection with functional memories. By a functional memory is understood a memory in which updates, such as additions, are carried out in such a way that first the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating is copied, and thereafter the update is made in the copied data (i.e., the update is not directly made to the existing data). Such an updating procedure is also termed “copy-on-write”.  
<summary>Background of the Invention</summary>
In overwrite memory environments, in which updates are not made in the copy but directly in the original data (overwrite), a FIFO queue is normally implemented by means of a double-ended list of the kind shown in FIG. 1. The list comprises nodes of three successive elements in a queue, three of such successive nodes being shown in the figure (references N(i−1), Ni and N(i+1)). The element on the first edge of each node has a pointer to the preceding node in the queue, the element on the opposite edge again has a pointer to the next node in the queue, and the middle element in the node has either the actual stored data record or a pointer to a record (the figure shows a pointer).  
<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The idea of the invention is to implement and maintain a queue by means of a tree-shaped structure in which the nodes have a given maximum size and (1) additions of data units (to the queue) are directed in the tree-shaped data structure to the first non-full node, seen from below, on the first edge of the data structure and (2) deletions of data units (from the queue) are also directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree, typically on the opposite edge. Furthermore, the idea is to implement the additions in such a way that the leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level of the tree-shaped data structure, which means that when such a non-full node is not present, new nodes are created to keep the leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level. The tree-shaped data structure will also be termed shortly a tree in the following.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The primary objective of the invention is to provide practical methods for building embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies. The invention aims to provide EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits and EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies. The invention also seeks to eliminate the need for high voltages for operations, making it possible to reduce manufacturing costs. The invention is designed to be practical and cost-effective, with the goal of supporting a wide variety of novel applications.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

* The invention provides a method for determining feedback gains in feedback control systems, enabling quick and accurate determination of the optimal value of feedback gain.
* The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step, calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value.
* This method permits a feedback gain providing for a suitable evaluation value to be calculated on the basis of the relation between feedback gain value and evaluation value, and it is thus possible to determine a feedback gain which can realize a suitable feedback control characteristic quickly and reliably.
* The invention is applicable to cases of obtaining the optimum values of feedback gains other than the P, I and D gains, and it can be used in various feedback control systems, including AGVs, AGVs running along a course, and AGVs running continuously along a course.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

* The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide-angle end with a reduced total length while still achieving high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
* The invention comprises a first lens unit with a positive refractive power for focusing, a second lens unit with a negative refractive power for varying the image magnification, a third lens unit with a negative refractive power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit with a positive refractive power for making the diverging light beam from the third lens unit an almost parallel light beam, and a fifth lens unit with a positive refractive power for image forming and having lenses of positive, negative, positive, negative, positive, and positive powers in this order.
* The invention achieves high correction of aberrations for high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range by satisfying the conditions for the construction and arrangement of the fourth and fifth lens units.
* The invention is achieved by setting the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit to the whole of the fifth lens unit to well correct spherical aberration, and the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit to well correct astigmatism without causing other aberrations.
* Four examples of specific zoom lenses of the invention can be constructed in accordance with the numerical data given in the tables for the radii of curvature, R, the axial thicknesses or air separations, D, and the refractive indices, ν, of the glasses of the various lenses with the subscriptions numbered consecutively from front to rear.
* The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of the aberrations by satisfying the conditions set forth above.

<summary>Summary:</summary> - The invention provides a method and device for detecting elementary particles, including a detector that generates a charge pulse when a particle passes through it. The method involves discharging the charge pulse on the low-voltage side, amplifying individual signals in a fast amplifier and integrating signals in a slow amplifier. The device also includes a support capacitor to separate signals at overlapping rates. The method enables both detection and integration of individual particles or pulses, providing reliable and simple separation during the detection of signals. The device is applicable in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and X-ray and CT devices. The method and device significantly reduce drawbacks of prior art methods and devices, enabling reliable detection and integration of small-size signals.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies.
• The apparatus includes a base with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and means for moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.
• The apparatus includes a control system with a microprocessor for reading sensor signals, controlling the torque motor and servo motor, and generating visual indications.
• The apparatus automatically determines whether the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances and generates external indications to the operator.
• The apparatus minimizes the chances of operator error by taking specific measurements for each assembly tested.

<summary>TECHNICAL FIELD</summary>
The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system, having a housing in which electronics and a communication means are arranged, wherein the communication means can be brought into communication with a communication means of the security system located on board the motor vehicle. 

<summary>BACKGROUND</summary>
DE 10 2010 061 331.2 discloses a keyless security system of a motor vehicle. In this case, the authorized user can actively operate the mobile identification transmitter in order to transmit a signal to the base station, for example a receiver unit included in the motor vehicle, to unlock/lock the motor vehicle. 

<summary>INVENTION</summary>
The invention addresses the problem of creating a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle which possesses an enlarged functionality and has a simple design, wherein at the same time the user is provided with a comfortable mobile identification transmitter.

<summary>**Summary of the Document:**

The document discusses an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use. When the device becomes inactive for a long period of time, the device is put into a "sleep mode" where most of the electric power is cut off to save energy. When the device wakes up from the sleep mode, it starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner. The document describes a method for charging toner in the imaging device, including determining periods of inactivity, measuring the charge level, and adjusting the toner supply based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level. The method is designed to improve image quality and reduce inconsistencies in image quality after a delayed period. The document also describes an apparatus for charging toner in the imaging device, including an inactivity determining section and a charging section. The method and apparatus are implemented in software or hardware, depending on the system's requirements. The document provides a detailed explanation of the charging process and its benefits for improving image quality and reducing inconsistencies in image quality after a delayed period.</summary>

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The invention provides a system and method that improves substantially the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object, such as a buried pipe or cable, in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The invention uses a transmitter and receiver system to detect and trace the presence of a cable (or pipe) in the presence of an adjacent cable.
• The transmitter generates alternating currents in the cable and induces magnetic fields that are sensed by a receiver.
• The receiver can sense both the magnetic fields and the current in the cable.
• The invention eliminates the distortion of the output signal characteristic when a second cable is present adjacent to the first.
• The invention can locate and trace one cable more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
• The invention can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables C and C'.
• The invention can produce an output signal characteristic only when both fields are sensed by the receiver.
• The invention can optimize the receiver's sensitivity to detect both fields.
• The invention can be used in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced.
• The invention can be used in environments where the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between an antenna and a cable.
